snippet: The German leader’s party placed third in state elections, beaten on the right over her refugee policy and defeated on the left as well....
abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel vows to maintain her chosen course despite sound defeat suffered by her party in national elections; results signaled voter rejection of her handling of refugees from Middle East over past year; admits she is 'very dissatisfied' with result and pledges to win back voter trust.
lead_paragraph: The German leader’s party placed third in state elections, beaten on the right over her refugee policy and defeated on the left as well.

headline.main: Merkel Vows to Stay on Course Despite Party Setback
headline.print_headline: Merkel Promises to Stay on Course Despite Setback in State Elections in Germany

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
